title: What are classical music notes? - Quora

response.answer_text: In Western music we have a total of 12 notes. These notes come from the distance between the first and second partials of nature’s harmonic overtone series. That distance is seven half steps, or a perfect 5th. By going around the circle of perfect 5ths, you get 12 notes. This is the foundation of Western music.
They have the same 12 notes that most music has. Why would they be any different?
